name: RomanescoBackyard
description: The Backyard is a place inside a Romanesco installation where multiple things come to life for the first time. It is a curated, centrally maintained collection of resources and translations. It functions as documentation, as living example, as front-end pattern library / style guide and as a playground for trying out new things.
author: Hugo Peek

resources.longtitle: Convey the right message in an orderly fashion
resources.description: Focus on: content hierarchy, structuring large amounts of information, connecting to other sources, etc.
Focus on: content alignment, visually dividing elements, inserting graphics and icons, using galleries and sliders, exploring different layout options, controlling paddings, etc.

resources.longtitle: Make finding the right content fast and effortless
resources.description: Focus on: solving navigational challenges, button usage, call to actions, using overviews, etc.

resources.longtitle: Show visitors that your (organization's) cause is just
resources.description: Focus on: testimonials, homepage hero unit, punchlines in page headers, showcasing portfolio projects, listing clients, etc.

resources.longtitle: Get your knowledge, data and opinions out there
resources.description: Focus on: creating different types of articles, creating a Publications overview page, displaying publication excerpts, writing newsletters, etc.

resources.longtitle: Take on a more visual approach to tell your story
resources.description: Focus on: tuning it up a notch from basic presentation; full-screen sliders, full-width backgrounds, tiled overviews, snapping images, etc.

resources.longtitle: Convince that what you offer is valuable and important
resources.description: Focus on: working towards a certain action (CTAs), getting better exposure in the first place (SEO), providing social proof (testimonials, ratings, reviews), etc.

resources.longtitle: Get in touch with your audience
resources.description: Focus on: contact information, social media sharing and channels, newsletter subscription, collecting feedback, etc.

resources.longtitle: Stay in touch with your audience
resources.description: Focus on: providing support, building good forms, striking the right tone of voice, using comments, etc.

resources.longtitle: Electrons are the subatomic particles of the system
resources.introtext:
Electrons, according to Wikipedia, are generally thought to be elementary particles because they have no known components or substructure. They play an essential role in numerous physical phenomena, such as electricity. They also function as a bonding mechanism for atomic systems.

Translated to MODX, things like TV's, Context Settings and System Settings can be interpreted as electrons. These elements contain small bits of information, that flow through the system (like electricity) to keep things in line with certain values. So essentially, they too bind things together.

Although not present in Brad Frosts' original Atomic Design principles, Electrons play a vital role in Romanesco as distributors of information. And like the rest of the Atomic elements, they are structured to be reusable.

resources.longtitle: Create crosslinks inside your Romanesco installation
resources.introtext: The Connections category contains TVs to create crosslinks inside a Romanesco installation. You can use a crosslink to connect team members to a MODX user ID for example. Or to a portfolio project, so their name and avatar can be shown on the project page.
